greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(-x, -x) * f(x^4, x^8) in powers of x where f(,) is Ramanujan's general theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/6) * eta(q)^2 * eta(q^8) * eta(q^12)^2 / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^24)) in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, x] EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, x^12] / QPochhammer[ x^4, x^8], {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^8 + A) * eta(x^12 + A)^2 / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^24 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 16 2015
